comment.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.nj.com/advice/2024/06/miss-manners-relatives-gifts-always-come-with-insults-attached.html](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nj.com%2Fadvice%2F2024%2F06%2Fmiss-manners-relatives-gifts-always-come-with-insults-attached.html) ### Comment > The problem has changed since you had me enabled the annoyance filters on ticket number 182340. The page displays normally with the annoyance filters enabled if I type the website (nj.com) manually into the Chrome address bar and then search for the article. If I click a link in the Google Discover feed, which is where I usually find the articles I'm trying to read, instead of getting the popup I had been seeing saying that an ad locker had been detected, I'm now getting a blank white screen. It's blank in the Google app and when I try to open the link in Chrome. If I disable the annoyance filters and click the link, I go back to seeing the notice the ad locker has been detected on both the Google app and Chrome browser. Since this is also the case for ticket 182157 (I just made a new report on that ticket), I'm assuming it is the same for tickets 182340, 182176 and 181350 as well. ### Screenshots

labels.name: Extra
labels.description: Issues, related to AdGuard Extra extension

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body: I can see in the closed section, that the issue has been reported several times before, something is definitely off. It might take some time for the issue to build up, and even then, the site works like 10% of the time. They might filter/blacklist IP's in a way when they detect adblocking, or the fact that they use proxy serves for google/bing hits, but I never seen similar behaviour from any other websites. Something's definitely off with this.
